website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy soft-sided suitcase that is available in multiple sizes and sets.
pros: Available in 6 different colors and 3 different sizes, plus a 2-piece set
Includes 2 inline wheels, telescoping handle, and a TSA-approved lock
Includes a size that is great for carry on luggage
cons: Several people had issues with the bag tipping over easily when packed

customer_reviews.title: Buyers beware -> this is not a 22" luggage
customer_reviews.text: was looking forward to a great value product from Amazon. Just opened up the package and shocked how small it is. I measured the inside space (see attached) and it measures 19.5" what really surprised me was no-one mentioned/noticed this??? if you are looking for a 20" luggage, this "may" be a good option for you.
customer_reviews.author: Artc

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and worked as a carry on for 1 week trip
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly great amount of storage. It fit a weeks worth of clothing and extra shoes without issue (granted I was going somewhere warm) and I had no issues flying United internationally and fitting in overhead bins. I have another amazon hard shell bag that’s a little smaller and that fits so much less. The embedded legs make all the difference in getting an extra inch or two of length. Also impressed with quality. Even the bag locks were easy to use and as a tall person the handle came up high enough.
customer_reviews.author: nicole l.

customer_reviews.title: Great carry on
customer_reviews.text: Other then it says Amazon basics on the little logo or cares as it is as big as they allow you to take The two rear wheels I think take up less cargo space all the zippers were quality and I can see you getting years of use out of it
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: How do you open it?
customer_reviews.text: Today I prepared to pack my new 26" suitcase in right shape and desirable color. But I can't open it! Does everyone know what a "TSA lock" is? I certainly don't. And no instructions came with the case. I am very upset, and I may return the suitcase. "Amazon Basics" indeed. Phooey.
customer_reviews.author: C. Clemson

customer_reviews.title: Meets the new airline size restrictions, with the most volume.
customer_reviews.text: Here's my best tip: Get one like this with only two in-line wheels. Those with four "caster" wheels decrease the bag's volume and they're not as strong. I need all the space I can get. Great fabric and colors, better than average key plastic reinforcements. Not "top of the line," but way better than anything close in price. Consider the flight crew style, too.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Best Carry-On Out There
customer_reviews.text: This is top line travel luggage. Very durable zippers. You can overpack and still get it closed. Best of all it’s an approved carry-on. Plus plenty durable enough to gate check on smaller planes.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Carrigg, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry, pack, move around
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suitcase as a carry-on for a trip to Europe. I packed all clothing and assorted necessities for 2 weeks in this case, carrying only my purse in addition to this suitcase.. It was perfect. I'm a bit older, so having the extra handles on the sides, I could move it from bed, to floor, to overhead very easily. It traveled perfectly, still looking like new. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: toastyfire

customer_reviews.title: Great suitcase, but won't survive a few trips
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these suitcases...they are light and appear well designed, but we took them on our first plan trip (a short 1.5 hour flight) and both suitcases have their bottom corners significantly abraded away. Sadly we didn't take our trip until after my amazon return window closed, so I basically have two disposable suitcases that will get tossed after one more trip or so. From the attached pictures you can see that both suitcases have been abraded down to the wire frame in the corners of the suitcases. There needs to be some plastic shields installed on the corners to prevent this type of damage.
customer_reviews.author: Hindmost

customer_reviews.title: Solid luggage set
customer_reviews.text: Bought this luggage to replace old luggage. I have spent the better half of a year checking out luggage and trying to find the best price. This set is fantastic. The bags are durable and are similar to many higher end luggage brands. The only concern I have about the blue color is dirt shows easier than I expected. I plan to buy a second set for my sister.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag.............But Flawed!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect bag for me. I travel about 45 weeks a year and I need something light weight, easy to grab and go, and I can throw in any airline overhead. It’s perfect for my 3-4 night trips. Only problem I have is pretty substantial. The foot on the bottom of the bag is set too far back from the front of the bag causing it to become off balanced and constantly falls when standing. Great bag, but this is annoying having to prop the bag next to a chair or wall to keep it from falling over.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Randell

customer_reviews.title: Great Suitcase for Frequent Travelers
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a carryon that fits the latest airline size requirements. This was the perfect choice. It's slightly smaller than the traditional carryon size so it fits easily in the overhead compartment. The outer pocket is the perfect size for a coat. Even with the expander open, it fit fine in the overhead compartment of the plane. The interior has two nice zipper pockets. The open area is large and contains straps. The wheels work well and the handle is a nice height. My only complaint is that the main zipper doesn't seem very durable. However, it's holding up great after several uses.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Damaged TSA lock 🔐
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed 😔 TSA lock arrived damaged, reason for the purchase. I had no time for an exchange since my son needed it immediately. According to him, when the baggage was on a upright position, on the wheels side, it would tip over & had to be leaning against something. Overall, it served the purpose, as a carry on & fit perfectly for the overhead bin for an international flight.
customer_reviews.author: SNewhouser

customer_reviews.title: Integrated Lock is Cheap and Breaks after 3mo
customer_reviews.text: I liked this bag at first, but now just after 3mo of using it, I've come to realize that the integrated TSA lock is a terrible design, as it's already broken for several reasons: 1. The left pull tab doesn't lock into place anymore 2. The reset button doesn't pop out after trying to set a new code 3. The lock will always unlock - regardless of the code. Definitely not happy with this product, as I feel like I should not have to buy a purchase plan just to make this last more than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Easy to roll & sturdy.  Simple lock.
customer_reviews.text: Brand name quality and dependability. I travel a lot, but I'm also cost conscious. I never see the point in buying an expensive brand name bag when I know I'll beat it up and have to buy a new one in a few years. The handle usually breaks, won't retract, and the wheels get dead spots. So far this suitcase has been perfect. The handle is sturdy and the wheels roll freely. It's lightweight and fits in an E170/190 overhead just fine, bigger airplanes, no problem. Update: Added some pics of the locking instructions and mechanism to help a lot of people asking about it.
customer_reviews.author: boilermonkey

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight very good quality bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice two wheel small carry on suitcase. It is noticeably lighter weight than both a several year old and a ten year old Delsey carry on that we have. It seems to be well made and slightly smaller than the Delsey bags, so it was easier to fit on a recent trip on a small plane (Bombardier CRJ-900) overhead bin. The zippers seem strong, as do the wheels and body of the luggage. Lock is easy to set and use. Also as you can tell it's relatively inexpensive. As of my first use I highly recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sysmg

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Well Built
customer_reviews.text: The overall build quality is quite good. I particularly like the oversize wheels. They will hold up well on sidewalks and roads. Also the handle extends far enough that I can comfortably tow it behind. Being tall, this is not something I have ever encountered before. I have always had to hunch as I towed my suitcase. Not with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Suitcase
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am very happy with this suitcase. It replaced an old rolling suitcase that I have had where the wheels finally fell off. The one thing I would note, be cautious with the milky pocket on the inside of the suitcase is very sensitive for putting things in it. I put a couple pairs of underwear in their and the pocket completely separated at the seam from the zipper. I am going to contact Amazon to see what they have to say about it. Hopefully they will honor a warranty period as I've only traveled with it twice in 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, just know you're buying a generic brand feel
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the price. They do their job and are well built, but you can tell that these were made on a budget. I wish I would have spent a little more and gotten a nicer set. These move around fine, but not as fluid as the more expensive brands. They zip up fine, but not as smoothly as the more expensive brands. Store things fine, but not as many compartments or pockets as other brands. These are great if all you need is affordable luggage. Though if you're looking for a nice set of luggage, spend a little bit more elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ty C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, TSA lock luggage!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Recently got back from a weeklong trip. It weathered well in the airport, on the trip, and back. The wheels work smoothly with no issues or breaking in the airport. I love the TSA lock as part of the luggage. The inside does not have any bells and whistles (i.e. extra pockets or compartments) which worked fine for our needs. It is a perfect size for traveling. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: S.M. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: disappointed :(
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for soft-sided carry on luggage options and chose this due to ratings. It is light weight, nice color, and seems sturdy; however, it topples over/does not stand up when packed, very annoying in the airport, had to park it against walls, my leg, pillars - whatever I could find or it was "bang" flat out in the floor. You must pull behind only and it is NOT maneuverable. Overall not happy with this choice and would have returned if the window wasn't already closed. Will not use this again.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a basic suitcase
customer_reviews.text: My last suitcase was destroyed in transit at the airport, so I was looking for something of fair quality for a fair price. I've been happy with the other AmazonBasics stuff I've purchased, so I thought I'd give this one a try. Checked out the construction/quality upon receiving, everything checked out. It's survived 4 flights, expands to accomodate luggage, zippers and compartments work for my purposes. Pleased with the aesthetics, function, and price. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Stylish, Too!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 2 piece 22"/26" set for a trip to Indonesia. Construction is good. Has TSA approved combo locks that are built in to the zipper, and are easy to set. Price is very good, compared to the name brands. 22" fits great in the overhead bins. 26" is for checking with the airline. Telescoping pull handles make for easy maneuvering through the airport.
customer_reviews.author: tgowan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent suitcase. Handled well in a long European trip.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a month long trip in Europe. Planes, Trains and Automobiles! Great basic suitcase, worked really well and held up really well. The added carry on size was a great bonus for the price. It is quite light, which I liked. The wheels are big enough to deal with cobble stone streets. Has a couple of compartments, but personally I use packing cubes and I want as few compartments as possible to keep things simple. My impression was that it was bigger than I expected, but the reported measurements were correct. So it was just me. I;'d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Best Suitcase for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I've been traveling on the road for 40 years, 1st Suitcase was an old hard sided one- latches failed, I've had several since- last one I bought lasted less than 2 years and was a pice of junk. I went shopping on Amazon and found this one- good quality, fills my needs and I Love the Mag Wheels! PS- it has a pull handle and does not ride on 4 wheels like the Girllie Ones do! (I'll probably get side ways with some people because of this comment- but after 40 years, I really don't care- I go by what works).
customer_reviews.author: bbv

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little carry-on!
customer_reviews.text: After extensive research I decided to buy two of these as they are the max size you can carry-on on most airlines. The design of the wheels is great because they don't take up must space, giving you more storage space for your stuff. It doesn't move around as easily as a four wheel bag, but well worth the trade off. The handles work great, I put heavy bags on the them and they held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Stone

customer_reviews.title: Superb Amazon quality and price
customer_reviews.text: This review is for: "AmazonBasics Upright Spinner Expandable Softside Suitcase Luggage with TSA Lock and Wheels" Upright luggage with inline (not spinner) wheels is hard to find. I was happy to see this on Amazon sold as an Amazon Basics brand which in my experience have always been of the highest quality. Although the unfortunate COVID-19 pandemic has greatly restricted travel, so far this luggage set appears to be extremely well-made with a tough durable high-quality fabric and overall excellent construction. Each suitcase is light and easy to maneuver, with plenty of room inside to pack your things. I saw one other option of another brand name, but went with Amazon Basics because of past experience with their excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Help

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality item.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for my 10 year old Kirkland (Costco) suitcase. I chose this item because I wanted a suitcase with 2 wheels, not 4. The suitcase that arrived appeared fragile and made of substandard materials.
customer_reviews.author: Mike the Geology Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials/design, falls over/doesn't stand up when full.
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase is okay. For the price, you could get something of better quality. The inside pocket is made of such cheap plastic, it tore with gentle/normal treatment (I put a lotion bottle in the pocket, and it rubbed against clothing on the other side, and broke the plastic). When the suitcase is full and the expansion is unzipped, it is too front-heavy, and won't stand up on its own. The wheels seem good, and the handles seem alright. It just feels cheap and like the materials won't hold up for long.
customer_reviews.author: MarrieO

customer_reviews.title: very unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase is very poorly designed. It falls over toward the front frequently. The front feet are placed too far back and it is unstable no matter how I pack it. I am going to give it away and get something better.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Good basic suitcase and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase survived the trip from Canada to Australia and back. The suitcase is sturdy and the zippers are good quality. The color makes it easily recognizable, which is a plus. The wheels are well made and we had no problems pulling it through multiple airports and through the streets. There were some scuffs after the trip, which cannot be avoided no matter how expansive your luggage is, but the suitcase stayed intact and will be good for many more trips to come.
customer_reviews.author: LKN

customer_reviews.title: Too large for carry on.
customer_reviews.text: Advertised to be an acceptable carry on size. It’s one inch wider than advertised and the flight attendant made me check the bag. Also toppled over fairly easy. Frustrating they falsely advertised the size.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Babb

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Very well made luggage. Still prefer this type over the spinner as this gives a bit more space on the bottom end being close to the floor, but not in anyway making contact. Passed Asiana Airlines carry-on policy on flight LAX-ICN-MNL-ICN-LAX. Some review complained about being short of 22 inches. That is becuase they measure the inside. Measure from the floor all the way to the handle. That is how airlines call you out and can visually tell you are beyond linear carry on limit.
customer_reviews.author: Jony760

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for price
customer_reviews.text: Been impressed with quality of this bag. Have used on about 8 trips so far and still looks brand new ( thank you airlines as well for not beating crap out of it) I prefer the 2 wheeled luggage bags over 4 wheel design, and are surprisingly more difficult to find with new 4 wheel popularity. Nice thick fabric exterior, Solid wheels tucked in for safety, Sturdy pull out handle, the nice touch of a grab handle on bottom for lifting when laying flat. A perfect size for, more then a couple days. Better then luggage I have paid twice as much for. Good job Amazon !! I would buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend! True to size.
customer_reviews.text: I only have positive things to say about this suitcase. I needed a 22” to fly as an overhead carryon and something I could use for staying a few nights with friends or family. The case I chose is beautiful blue, super light and easy to steer. The zipper tab is the best I’ve used. I like that the wheels are tucked in the suitcase instead of the suitcase standing upon wheels. It seems like like doing so it makes the body of this case bigger. Most all airlines I would choose require carryons to be 22” and measured this really is true. No surprises at the airport that it isn’t. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality but INCORRECT (small) size!
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars for quality & 1 star for providing inaccurate size. It states on the Amazon website that the height is 21.6" - It's actually 19" (See photos). Interestingly even the maker of this carry-on states on the box (See photo) that it is 19" When I buy a Carry-on Luggage I would like to get to the biggest I am allowed by the Airline. Current limit is 22" - 19" is way too small! So I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy G.

customer_reviews.title: Built-in TSA Lock is a Vulnerability
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to be a nice suitcase in the 24 hours we had it, but the lock jammed and I could no longer get the suitcase open or reset the lock. The lock was apparently defective. I sent it back for a refund and purchased a different model. Think carefully about what you will do if the TSA lock freezes up while you are traveling because the only immediate solution would be to cut off the two zipper pulls that fit into the lock.
customer_reviews.author: Brent D

customer_reviews.title: Great luggage for carry on
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this is a better piece of luggage than I was expecting. I like that the wheels are not the swivel type, because it means the luggage has more volume for clothes and stuff. I have had no issues at all pulling it and going around corners etc, it doesn't tip over like some luggage does. In general the build quality is very good. I'm happy with this purchase, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Good rolling suit case for a  carry on luggage.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice carry on travel case. I was able to fit enough clothes for 5 days, including a spare pair of dress shoes in there. The carry on will fit in every over head storage bin for every airline. This case falls below the size minimum for every major airline company. I used this bag for international travel, third world travel, hot dusty environments, and it still looks brand new. Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CCCL350

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and rugged wheels
customer_reviews.text: I like this suitcase because instead of having 4 wobbly wheels like the others, it has two sturdy wheels. I also like how it has the TSA lock for added security. It also has a little plastic pull out template where you can put your name and address and phone number so no need for a luggage tag. I can pack this thing pretty tightly, replaced an old bag that I used to use for travelling, now my back is thanking me. It also has an added handle in-between the wheels to help load it into a car, as well as an extra handle on the side. I really like this suitcase!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Light and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small suitcase for carry-on, but also wanted recessed wheels in case I needed to check my bag. The size seemed too small at first. But I've used it several times now and I'm amazed at how much I can get into this bag. Plus, lightweight and seems very durable. This was a great purchase. I'll get years of use out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Riker

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge traveler, but I needed a new suitcase (the wheel on my old one broke). This suitcase set does the job! The small one is good for a one-person short trip, and the larger one was big enough to hold everything for a family of five for two nights. It is well made, and easy to use. I haven't tried the combination lock yet, but it looks like it is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hphillips12

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for international carry on. No worry about spinner wheels breaking off.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find luggage suitable for international carry on flights, as they are smaller than USA. These inline wheels work well on all surfaces, including cobblestone streets. We just returned from the UK and they held up great to three weeks of a lot of use. We did not check it in as they passed all size requirements. These measurements INCLUDE wheels and handle. Use this size for three weeks of travel!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Solid Value - Carry On Bag
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to lift into a car trunk or plane overhead bin. Rolls very smooth and just the right size for a long weekend trip. Strudy pull handle plus the zippers are large & easy to handle. Time will tell about wear & overall durability. Initial impression is favorable and it should compete well with a comparable Samsonite 21-22" carry on bag. 😉💼
customer_reviews.author: David Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Good value lightweight carryon bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lightweight carryon bag for a weeklong trip to Ireland and Scotland. It worked SO well. Roomy for its size and very light weight. It is durable enough to handle plane and bus on/off handling and hotel transport. The handle seemed a bit flimsy at home, but it handled this trip and hopefully other in the future very well. Since it has 2 wheels not 4, there is some loss of maneuverability, especially down the aisle of a plane. But the lightweight design of this bag really makes up for that. Good price too.
customer_reviews.author: Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for checked luggage for the price. While it does not have a premium luggage cost, it still has premium luggage features. The integrated lock is a really nice feature. And it holds a lot, especially with only two wheels. Also very lightweight. The con is that it doesn't feel as heavyweight as more premium luggage. Will see how it holds up. But after 3 trips so far, it still looks like new
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Y

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag for a 3 week international trip. I couldn’t be happier with how it performed. I was able to fit in all the things I planned to bring and had room for a few more purchased on the vacation. The bag is very well made and stood up to multiple airlines treatment. It’s super light weight which is great as the weight limits have decreased for most airlines. It was a great size for traveling on trains in two different countries - fitting between the seats. Value for the money is spot on for this bag. It was lighter, just as strong, and TSA lockable compared with friends’ bags who I travelled with.
customer_reviews.author: lcmess

customer_reviews.title: 19" size NOT expandable
customer_reviews.text: The listing combines several different sizes. The common headline says "expandable". I can see from the reviews that some of the other sizes are expandable. But the 19" size, which I bought, is not expandable.
customer_reviews.author: RPG

customer_reviews.title: Almost ideal.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my first trip with it. The only issue was the zipper. In one area, the zipper teeth would not line up with every use. This is a trouble spot with plastic zippers that I bet would not get better with time. Upon my return I contacted amazon for an exchange. I’m hoping the replacement will be better. Over all the suitcase worked as intended. The construction held up well thru two international flights. The zipper was the only issue.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately Poorly Built
customer_reviews.text: Even though I was initially excited about the purchase, not even two trips in, I realized the suitcase is unfortunately purely built. The top textile handle does not hold in, wheels have a tendency go sideways even with less than 50 lbs of weight, zipper already gave out twice, and today my stuff inside got completely wet when handled by airport through mild rain. Originally, I wanted to buy one extra for my mom, but after even fairly light use over last several months, I cannot recommend the product, unless you are buying it for one time use only.
customer_reviews.author: John Humble

customer_reviews.title: Seemingly nice bag
customer_reviews.text: Can’t do a full review as the trip this was purchased for got cancelled (thanks pandemic). It appears to be a well made bag (materials, craftsmanship, features), and we look forward to using it. The wheels roll smoothly and the bag doesn’t tip easily. Plus, my husband is very tall, so he very much likes the length of the pull handle. Perhaps I’ll update this review once we’ve actually used the bag.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Good Product For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a basic carry-on for both domestic and international travel. I did not want to spend a fortune so I decided on The Amazon Premium Basics. Its a great product, durably built, and maneuverable. The product was better than expected. I just got back from an overseas trip where I both carried it on the plane and also checked it on the return home. No issues and in great shape still. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: California John

customer_reviews.title: Great, secure little carry on suitcase!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is great! I love the locks, but my favorite part is the silicon/plastic pockets inside that are great for storing damp swimsuits or face cloths! It fit perfectly into every overhead compartment on all of my flights, even those tiny little ones ones on the regional jets.
customer_reviews.author: Niesje

customer_reviews.title: Very popular at the baggage carousel
customer_reviews.text: Great suitcase, very comparable to a Travel Pro, which we also bought on Amazon. The one, single problem with either of these brands is their popularity. There were at least a dozen of the exact same bag (and color) on our flight last month. Personalizing your bag is a necessity to avoid confusion. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: RealisticConsumer

customer_reviews.title: just what you would expect in a carry on
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this once so far for a weekend where we flew. It was good in the airport, easy to roll along, sturdy, and I was able to fit everything I needed for a long weekend in it. I did not bother using the tsa lock thing but it seems easy enough to use if you wanted to and you can ignore it if you don't want to use it. We bought a blue and purple one and I was very happy with the colors.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Middle-East 21-day Test
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a pair, loaded each up to 35-37 lbs total, with the expansion zipper opened, and checked baggage in-out of 7 airports en route. The result: other than a little dirt on one, both showed little use. We even hitched each of our 17 lb. smaller carry-on case handle-to-handle of the big one, and rolled through lobbies and sidewalks with ease of handling. We never tried the TSA lock. The suitcase exceeded our expectation for such a rigorous itinerary.
customer_reviews.author: rich10633

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for short trips.
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase is the perfect size for a short trip and it fits in the overhead bin. I was away for 6 days and was able to fit everything that I needed and still overpacked. I even stowed a pair of hiking boots. It's lightweight and easy to maneuver. Although the wheels don't swivel, I had no issues moving through the airport with this suitcase because it's so light. An added bonus is that a smaller bag forced me to really think about what I needed to bring along, and honestly, it's not much. It's plenty sturdy, very similar to the tough, bigger case that I have. And, you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: ginger

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: I've not used them yet so I'm not sure of the quality BUT had I know that they were made in China, I would have never ordered. I assumed (never works out well) that with 2 day prime, that they weren't made in China. I'm very disappointed that a disclosure wasn't on description. I try to buy American made and don't buy Chinese items. HARD LESSON LEARNED! MADE IN THE USA IS THE WAY TO GO!!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!  Won't stand upright when loaded
customer_reviews.text: We have not used this carry-on enough to judge its durability, but it will not and does not stand upright by itself when loaded to capacity, especially when the outer pocket is used. If you need to stop towing it, you have to prop the handle against something or it will just fall to the floor. This luggage expands far less than most other carry-on luggage, which makes its tipsy nature even more peculiar and frustrating. Since carry-on luggage must travel with the passenger through the airport and stop at various points for various reasons, it seems unsuited for its intended purpose. This is a poorly designed product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Swan

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for us
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this bag because it was within the allowable dimensions to take on Amtrak. It worked well for us on a trip to Washington DC. We found it to be sturdy and it rolled well.
customer_reviews.author: J. DuBose

customer_reviews.title: Nice basic carry on
customer_reviews.text: Bought this right before going on an international trip as a carry on. It fit on every plane, including the smaller regional jets. It fit everything I needed and was easy to roll around and fit into the overhead bins. The only thing that seems a bit flimsy is the handle. I have had no issues, but I am wondering on the durability of the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Bill P

customer_reviews.title: Adequate, but not a favorite
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my existing suitcase because it had totally worn out. It had 2 wheels, and although 4-wheeled suitcases are the rage right now, I didn't want to get one for a piece of luggage that was going to be checked. This is the only style that had 2 wheels and the reviews were okay. This piece is wider than my previous case, and, as such, unwieldy. I had an awkward time lifting it because of that. The locking mechanism was nice, as was the fabric. It worked for that trip, but will I continue to use it? Probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Jean H

customer_reviews.title: Great suitcase at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this suitcase! It is a great size (22 in) and is really stable. No tipping over! The purple is beautiful and helps make it stand out! The stitching is nice and is solidly made. I really like the inline wheels. I actually prefer them over the bulky, easily broken spinner wheels. The lock was super easy (I'm not sure why others have had issues). My only wish is that it had a smaller front pocket for smaller items to be easily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Falls over with a Computer Bag on top.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my last rollaboard this one falls over with my computer bag on top of it. Huge bummer!!! Also, the handle is just long enough to not match the height of the computer bag. Another bummer that my previous bag did not have. Other than those major annoyances, it rolls fine, the handle goes up and down and the wheels roll, so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase has a strong value proposal. It is very sturdy, even more due to the fixed wheels. I actually don't like the spinning wheels because their protruding design makes them an easy target. It is also very compact and lightweight, for an affordable price. The seams are well done and the fasteners feel right. Lastly, it comes with a built-in locker, what saves you another $10.
customer_reviews.author: Joao Poneis

customer_reviews.title: Good, economical and sturdy bag.
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a 3 week tour of the UK. This wheeled bag from Amazon was our single check-in bag. It is a pull-type bag with 2 wheels, not the four-wheeled coaster type. It held up perfectly through the airline baggage handler's trials and was easy to wheel from car to destinations across our trip. The zippers worked flawlessly. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Vieux

customer_reviews.title: Great for business traveler.
customer_reviews.text: It’s luggage, that’s it. A fair price for something better than most. Easy to maneuver and handle. Plenty storage, no frills other than the zipper lock. Held 2 suits and a full week’s clothes and shoes for a business trip to DC. Nice exterior, suggest getting a sleeve/cover if checking at the airport. Remember the old samsonite luggage commercial with the gorilla?
customer_reviews.author: Lake_lj

customer_reviews.title: TSA lock broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: The suitcase overall is lightweight but also cheap materials. I used it one time and the TSA lick broke and my suitcase arrived half zipped. Luckily I used the interior straps to hold my belongings so nothing was lost. I will probably be throwing if away or giving to someone who could use it for car travel. I need a sturdy suitcase for air travel.
customer_reviews.author: KTB

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Not quality Not type of product to order on line If could have seen in person would not have bought Definitely not Amazon Quality Will donate to charity, only get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Good Quality Alternative if you travel alot.
customer_reviews.text: I am a flight attendant for a major airline. My Company approved Travel -Pro bag broke after 9 months of use. I needed a cheap quick alternative that was small and lightweight. This bag delivers! I am on the road 20 days a month and it is holding up pretty well. My only concern is the wheels which seem a bit on the cheap side. So far so good a couple of months in though. Beats the way more expensive Travel-Pro hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great basic checked bag
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had this suitcase for too long, but it seems to be working great. With the airlines cracking down on size for checked bags, it's tough to find a roomy bag. we gave up on the 4 wheel models because the wheels use up too much of the size allowance, and this bag was for check in anyway. This case uses the space wisely, and the price point can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Only used it once, but very happy with it so far
customer_reviews.text: It survived a trip to Europe and back with no scars. I like that it has a little more space than my regular suitcases, but is still reasonably compact. I like that the wheels are not protruding such as on other models, but are neatly recessed. Seems pretty sturdy. The TSA friendly lock is a nice feature - easy to use. No complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bracken

customer_reviews.title: Biggest Carry On
customer_reviews.text: This carry on suitcase has only two wheels(which I like) and the wheels are flush with the bottom of the suitcase. The 4 wheel suitcases are on the outside of the suitcase thus the suitcase area is smaller. This AmazonBasics carry on suitcase has more room than any other 4 wheel carry on suitcases that I looked at. The two wheels roll fine for me and I get more suitcase space. This makes this suitcase a five for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: 30 Minute Layover - Worked Great To Carry On Small Plane
customer_reviews.text: I found suitcase well-made - not quite the quality of $225 carry-on that fits larger overhead planes, but almost. Solid wheels that enabled me to walk home 2.25 miles after 2 flights of 6 hours that took 11 hours from 6 am alarm. Useful for whatever I'm up to here or for travel. Green color is pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: MR. Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: A better choice!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for my wife for short trips ~ we found it better built and less expensive than the other brand names on the site. About a year ago before the Amazon 22 inch was available, I purchased a brand name case just like it for about $25 more ~ I find the Amazon brand one I got for my wife better than mine. Would recommend the Amazon brand if you find one the size you need.
customer_reviews.author: SoutheWind

customer_reviews.title: Decent suitcase, not a "spinner"
customer_reviews.text: I got the 28-inch red model. This is a two-wheel suitcase (which is what I wanted), despite "spinner" in the description title. I purchased used (via Amazon) for $41.47. So, a decent suitcase for the money. It does lack some features one would expect: the pull-out handle only has one length, it does not lock in the middle; it's scant on extra pockets, compartments, etc. It's just very basic. The red is easy to spot at baggage claim.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Singer

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I received my new luggage yesterday and while I haven't used it yet, it looks fantastic. No one could believe this is AmazonBasics - it looks and feels like much higher end luggage. The deep blue color is very nice and the interior has plenty of space / compartments. It will be put to its first test this weekend - will update after it is put to some use.
customer_reviews.author: WG

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy handle, but otherwise okay
customer_reviews.text: 1. Large wheels roll nicely 2. Handle is very flimsy and jiggles around a lot 3. Construction is rather flimsy, but very lightweight (could be good or bad) They could have done better for the cost, in my opinion. It doesn't feel "tough" like my old Swissgear carry-on did.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality, but not the right dimensions for my US domestic airline
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality and decent design for a product at this price point, with 70 bucks in your pocket and a trip coming up this is the clear choice. That said, this bag didn't meet the maximum airline dimensions stated by American Airlines. To be clear, the luggage does fit in the overhead, but clearly exceeds the airline's advertised maximum dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Jager

customer_reviews.title: Carry on bag
customer_reviews.text: The travel bag managed quite well on the first trip. I seemed to be able to get everything I wanted plus some in. The side slot for laptop was very handy when going through security. The Special lock was my one problem. I couldn't get to latch at all, so I didn't work on it very much so I wouldn't have to break something to get it opened.
customer_reviews.author: Shubs

customer_reviews.title: good conventinal suitcase
customer_reviews.text: The suitcase seems to be well-built and provides all the functionality that I wanted. Was looking for a sturdy 2-wheeler, since the wheels on most 2-wheelrs are the Achilles hill. Seems to be roomy, light and functional. I also appreciate TSA-approved built-in lock since my locks always get cut especially on international flights. Have not taken it for a trip yet, but plan to do so within a month.
customer_reviews.author: Boris A

customer_reviews.title: Its luggage
customer_reviews.text: Handled a round trip flight to Miami and a cruise. The wheels on these are tucked in tight and can handle far more than the stupid 4 bottom casters that will break off. Ask me how I know.... The locks are simple to use. If you have an issue with the locks it's because of YOU not the locks.
customer_reviews.author: NO Way

customer_reviews.title: Too small but a nice bag if you pack light.
customer_reviews.text: Was trying to replace my old roller bag from Wilson’s Leather. This bag from Amazon isn’t bad, it’s just much smaller than I wanted and the pockets aren’t as deep, but you do get more of them. Probably easier to get in and out of overhead bins on a plane- but you’re bringing less clothes and essentials with ya so be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Justin McPherson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Well built, sturdy, and with nice zippers. It was unfortunately too shallow at about 7 inches depth and didn’t fit all what I needed to pack. Will meet strict European carryon requirements.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Interior plastic compartment broke after 1 use. Otherwise seems good
customer_reviews.text: I don't have high hopes for its durability, given that the interior plastic compartment ripped away from the seam the first time I put something in it (it has NO give and therefore is useless for putting clothes in - my old suitcase had this compartment and worked perfectly for dirty underwear-stocks). Looks good, maneuvers well for a 2-wheeler.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle bar got stuck straight out of the box - had to return
customer_reviews.text: As titled, the handle bar got stuck and would not go back down, straight out of the box. This made the return a little bit of a nuisance since the bag wouldn't fit back into its original box, so I had to purchase another box. That being said, Amazon refunded any extra costs.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price - classy looking
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the navy blue as our single checked bag for an overseas trip. It held up great! The two wheels really help navigate cobblestone streets and other rough terrain. Spinner wheels are very nice when navigating airplane and train cars. Too bad you can't convert the wheels, but that's about the only negative, here. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: WI mom

customer_reviews.title: not TSA approved
customer_reviews.text: First of all it was destroyed when I got to my destination because TSA couldn't open it. Then it tore after that like a ripple effect. One trip and it was done. I was supposed to do multiple countries and I only managed to get to one. I had to buy a new one at my first destination. I was excited about the color and how light it was but got disappointed right away.
customer_reviews.author: lacver

customer_reviews.title: Great value, but broke right away
customer_reviews.text: I love these suitcases for the price. However, after my first trip with them, the handle of the smaller suitcase is now broken and stuck in the up position. I was going to contact amazon, but I have no idea how to ship it back with the handle like that.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Nice Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suitcase for a short trip to Texas. I bought it in purple and loved the color. I did not have a problem with it at all. It been a while since I have bought any luggage so I liked how the zipper tabs lock on it. It doesn't have the quick maneuverability of a bag with 4 wheels but it moves well. I would recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: 22" high bag is 15" wide at wheels
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bag because the dimensions were supposed to be correct for a carry on for American Airlines, 22"x14"x8". With the wheels, the bag is 15" wide. The bag appears to be well designed, but I can't risk not passing the size restrictions at the airport. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly P. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Not 28 inches.
customer_reviews.text: Very weak flimsy sides. Not to mention the size description is wrong the outer dimensions is only 26 inches high not the 28. I wanted a bag without the spinner wheels for the extra space to pack. Its the same size as a med 26 bag.
customer_reviews.author: SLBJWS

customer_reviews.title: Good solid affordable carry-on
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight good looking suitcase. However seems to easily be unbalanced / tipover if luggage weight is not just right. Worried about the quality of the zippers lasting years down the road. But otherwise good small carry-on bag for a very good price. I will likely grab the next size up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Elias Shamos

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase is sturdy, but with that sturdiness comes weight. What I appreciate the most about the design is it doesn’t fall forward when packed and setting upright. The wheels roll well, and the telescoping handle is plenty long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Chimes at Midnight Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Slightly over carry on requirements
customer_reviews.text: This was great size and loved the design. It’s officially one inch over the carry on requirements tho so I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: ZephiesGirl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome carry-on with great looks.  Perfect for short getaway.
customer_reviews.text: Based on my past experience, I have found that AmazonBasics offer great value, so when I was looking for a carry-on and found this suitcase it was a no-brainer. Great looks, quality build, and ability to fit in the overhead storage compartment of an airplane, makes this an excellent buy. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Surprising find
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I was extremely surprised when this arrived and felt sturdy and well made. I was skeptical that it would look nice but underperform, but so far after a weeklong trip its held up spectacularly and maneuvers very smoothly
customer_reviews.author: Cas N.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid, fair price
customer_reviews.text: This bag is the right size for Alaska Airlines carry-on, which was one critical factor in the choice. It is pretty solid, not a bad price. The TSA lock is kinda Mickey Mouse, but that is OK. Easy to pull thru the airport.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  High quality.
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly the right size for a 2-3 business trip. I don't care for the trend to 4 wheels and the large dual wheels are perfect. The quality looks very good. We'll see a year from now after 40 or so trips
customer_reviews.author: E. Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: Works on Norwegian
customer_reviews.text: Spent days searching for something I knew Norwegian would accept - this worked. My only gripe is the double wheels, they work just fine, but I’ll be going four wheels next time. Otherwise a fantastic option for dual wheel The water resistant pocket was key!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Returned. It didn’t fit at the isle of the airplane
customer_reviews.text: This one was not as depicted for measurements. They handle kept getting in the way and I couldn’t get down the aisle on the airplane. They should make it where the handle goes flat against the body of the suitcase
customer_reviews.author: CLW

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Upright Spinner Expandable Softside Suitcase Luggage with TSA Lock and Wheels
feature_bullets: Outer dimensions (including wheels): 16.7 x 9.8 x 24 Inches; Interior dimensions: 13.7 x 8.4 x 20.6 Inches
24-inch premium softside suitcase for savvy travelers
2 inline wheels and sturdy telescoping handle ensure comfortable rolling
Strategically placed support stabilizers help prevent tipping
Protective reinforcements include crash-guard wheel housings, skid guard, and molded corner guards
Built-in TSA lock offers an added level of security; sleek Black color
